subtitle: The following charts and graphs offer a multifaceted exploration of the landscape of school food programs to better understand their implications for student nutrition and well-being. These visuals provide a comprehensive view of how schools approach the vital task of nourishing their students, and the potential impacts of these programs on children's dietary habits, academic performance, and overall health.

charts.name: Offered School Food Programs
charts.blurb: This chart highlights the distribution of the School Food Programs offered in the GTA.

charts.name: School Food Program Timings
charts.blurb: This chart highlights the various times throughout the school day that School Food Programs are offered.

charts.name: % of Schools Implementing SFPs
charts.blurb: This chart highlights the percentage of schools implementing School Food Programs.

charts.name: Frequency of SFPs Offered Per Week
charts.blurb: This chart highlights the frequency of School Food Programs offered in a week.

charts.name: Number of SFPs Offered per School
charts.blurb: This chart highlights the number of School Food Programs offered at each school in the GTA.

charts.name: Types of School Nutrition Education
charts.blurb: This chart higlights the various types of nutrition education offered in GTA schools.

charts.name: Most Common SFP Payment Models
charts.blurb: This chart highlights the most common School Food Program payment models in the GTA.

charts.name: Most Common SFP Funding Models
charts.blurb: This chart highlights the most common School Food Program funding models in the GTA.

subtitle: The following charts and graphs shed light on various aspects of children's nutrition. These visuals delve into the origins of GTA children's meals, serving methods, factors determining food choices, and the top energy-rich food categories, all of which influence policies and initiatives working to improve children's health and well-being.

charts.name: Origins of GTA Childrens' Meals
charts.blurb: This chart highlights and analyzes the various origins of meals of children in the GTA.

charts.name: Serving Methods Across Meal Types
charts.blurb: This chart highlights the various serving methods across different meal types.

charts.name: Factors Determining Food Served
charts.blurb: This chart highlights the various factors that determine and influence the food served in School Food Programs.

charts.name: Top 10 Energy-Rich Food Categories
charts.blurb: This chart higlights the top 10 food categories for energy at school.

subtitle: The following charts and graphs illuminate crucial insights into parental perspectives regarding school food programs and their preferences for childrenâ€™s participation, enrolment decisions, types of SFPs offered, timings, funding models, and affordability. These key insights help inform policymakers and educators about parental priorities when developing effective school food programs.

charts.name: For Children to Participate in SFPs
charts.blurb: This chart highlights parents' preference for their child(ren) to participate in School Food Programs.

charts.name: For Enrolling Children in SFPs
charts.blurb: This chart highlights parental enrollment of their children in School Food Programs categorized by the childrens' age.

charts.name: For Not Enrolling Children in SFPs
charts.blurb: This chart highlights parental refusal of enrollment of their children in School Food Programs categorized by the childrens' age.

charts.name: For Types of SFPs to be Offered
charts.blurb: This chart highlights parents' preference of offered School Food Programs.

charts.name: For Times that SFPs are Offered
charts.blurb: This chart highlights parents' preference of the timings of School Food Programs to be offered.

charts.name: For Types of SFP Funding Models
charts.blurb: This chart highlights parents' preferred funding models for School Food Programs.

charts.name: For Max Affordable Daily Meal Cost
charts.blurb: This chart highlights the maximum cost that parents and caregivers can afford to pay for Lunch/Breakfast Programs (per day).

subtitle: The following charts and graphs explore the opinions of parents on various school food program related topics, including cultural and less processed foods, portion sizes, beverage inclusion, meal affordability, customization options, food accommodations, sustainability, nutrition education, and program evaluation. These insights help guide efforts to improve SFPs to better meet children's dietary needs and preferences.

charts.name: Menu Aligns with Canada Food Guide
charts.blurb: This chart higlights parents' opinions on menu alignment with Canada's Food Guide in School Food Programs.

charts.name: Importance of Cultural Food
charts.blurb: This chart highlights parents' opinions on having culturally appropriate foods, focusing on vegetables, whole grains and fruits being served.

charts.name: Importance of Less Processed Food
charts.blurb: This chart higlights parents' opinions on having meals and snacks be minimally processed (fewer pre-packaged, ready-to-eat foods).

charts.name: Various Food Portions Offered
charts.blurb: This chart higlights parents' opinions on having various food portions be offered.

charts.name: Meals Coming With a Beverage
charts.blurb: This chart higlights parents' opinions on having meals be accompanied by a beverage.

charts.name: Low-Sugar, Low-Salt, Low-Fat Meals
charts.blurb: This chart higlights parents' opinions on having meals with low sugar, salt and fat.

charts.name: Free or Low-Cost Meals
charts.blurb: This chart higlights parents' opinions on having meals be offered for free or at a low cost.

charts.name: Children's Ability to Participate
charts.blurb: This chart higlights parents' opinions on having all or most children at school able to participate in School Food Programs.

charts.name: SFPs Unique to Childrens' Needs
charts.blurb: This chart higlights parents' opinions on having School Food Programs cater to childrens' specific needs.

charts.name: Customizable Food Selection
charts.blurb: This chart higlights parents' opinions on having them and their child(ren) choose the type of food served.

charts.name: Food Accomodations & Flexibility
charts.blurb: This chart higlights parents' opinions on there being accomodations made for childrens' allergies, intolerances, and/or religious dietary practices.

charts.name: Locally Grown & Sustainable Food
charts.blurb: This chart higlights parents' opinions on having food purchased for the program be locally grown and sustainably produced.

charts.name: Children Nutrition Education
charts.blurb: This chart higlights parents' opinions on children learning how food is grown and ends up on their plate.

charts.name: Children Involvement in Food Prep
charts.blurb: This chart higlights parents' opinions on children becoming involved in the preparation of the food.

charts.name: Children Socializing while Eating
charts.blurb: This chart higlights parents' opinions on children eating together with an adult and socializing during the meals.

charts.name: Canadian Nutritional Standards
charts.blurb: This chart higlights parents' opinions on following Canada-wide nutritional standards to ensure food safety.

charts.name: National Program Evaluation
charts.blurb: This chart higlights parents' opinions on there being consistent Canada-wide School Food Program evaluation.

charts.name: Feedback on School Food Programs
charts.blurb: This chart higlights parents' opinions on there being opportunity for caregivers and children to provide regular feedback on the School Food Program.
